channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-4308] Newly added test TestCliDriver.hiveprofiler_union0 is failing on trunk
item.description: This only happens while running whole test suite. Failure doesn't manifest if this test is run alone.
item.summary: Newly added test TestCliDriver.hiveprofiler_union0 is failing on trunk

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/2049/testReport/ is one such instance.
While running whole suite it fails with following stack:

    [junit] Running: diff -a /home/ashutosh/hive/build/ql/test/logs/clientpositive/hiveprofiler_union0.q.out /home/ashutosh/hive/ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/hiveprofiler_union0.q.out
    [junit] 9a10,19
    [junit] > SEL_5 ==> UNION_6: 414
    [junit] > FIL_10 ==> SEL_5: 414
    [junit] > TS_0 ==> FIL_9: 500
    [junit] > TS_3 ==> FIL_10: 500
    [junit] > UNION_6 ==> SEL_7: 498
    [junit] > SEL_2 ==> UNION_6: 84
    [junit] > FIL_9 ==> SEL_2: 84
    [junit] > main() ==> TS_3: 500
    [junit] > main() ==> TS_0: 500
    [junit] > SEL_7 ==> FS_8: 498
    [junit] Exception: Client execution results failed with error code = 1
    [junit] See build/ql/tmp/hive.log, or try "ant test ... -Dtest.silent=false" to get more logs.
    [junit] Failed query: hiveprofiler_union0.q
I have seen similar behavior with test hiveprofiler0.q which fails with similar stack when run in full suite. Oddly though, even in full suite run I observe that randomly.

pamelavagata Would you like to take a look at this one? This is consistently failing in all my test runs. Apache build machine has same problem:
https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/2055/testReport/
https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/2052/testReport/
https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/2051/testReport/

Also, HIVE-4318 might be of interest to you.

I was a little investigating this. It seemed connection for embedded derby is not closed properly.

pamelavagata Were you able to take a look? This is the only test which is now failing. See: https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/2065/testReport/
I want to setup CI for 0.11 branch on apache build machines to track 0.11 status. It will be good to have those builds as green. If you think, it might take longer shall we just disable this test for now?

Also, if something is wrong with derby, you might want to try with newer version of derby. See, HIVE-4257

I've dig a little more and found embedded derby cannot be used for this use case (Multiple clients with different class-loader might access to single embedded derby database). If it's only for test, changing code parts in HiveProfilerStatsAggregator#populateAggregateStats makes test passed.

  getProfileStatsStmt.close();
  rawProfileConnInfo.getConnection().close();
} catch(Exception e) {
  LOG.error("executing error: ", e);
}

to 

  populateAggregateStats(result);
  getProfileStatsStmt.close();
  } catch(Exception e) {
    LOG.error("executing error: ", e);
  } finally {
    HiveProfilerUtils.closeConnection(rawProfileConnInfo);
  }
navis Thanks for digging into this. Can you format this as a patch? I will take a look.
[navis] Thanks for looking into this - I didn't get a chance to look through this yet but it looks like you've found a solution
let me know if there's anything I can do.

navis requested code review of "HIVE-4308 [jira] Newly added test TestCliDriver.hiveprofiler_union0 is failing on trunk".

Reviewers: JIRA

HIVE-4308 Newly added test TestCliDriver.hiveprofiler_union0 is failing on trunk

This only happens while running whole test suite. Failure doesn't manifest if this test is run alone.

TEST PLAN
EMPTY

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D10269

AFFECTED FILES
ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/profiler/HiveProfilerStatsAggregator.java

MANAGE HERALD RULES
https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/view/differential/

WHY DID I GET THIS EMAIL?
https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/transcript/24555/

To: JIRA, navis
It's a walkaround but a solution. But for now, it seemed to be enough.
